metadata.key_specifications: Working voltage (VZ) range from 2.4 V to 15 V, differential resistance (rdiff) from typical 1.5 Ohm to 120 Ohm at IZ = 5 mA, temperature coefficient (SZ) from typical 1.7 mV/K to 4.6 mV/K at IZ = 5 mA, diode capacitance (Cd) from typical 80 pF to 15 pF at f = 1 MHz, VR = 0 V, non-repetitive peak reverse current (IZSM) up to 6.5 A
metadata.applications: The datasheet does not explicitly mention main applications, but being automotive qualified (AEC-Q101) suggests it is suitable for automotive applications.

11.  Test information
Quality information
This product has been qualified in accordance with the Automotive Electronics Council (AEC)
standard Q101 - Stress test qualification for discrete semiconductors, and is suitable for use in
automotive applications.

Product Summary.content: General description, key features, and benefits of the product, including an overview and general description of its functionality and capabilities.
Applications and use cases for the product, as well as quick reference data and pinning information that provides essential details for understanding and implementing the product.
Ordering information, marking details, and limiting values that define the product's specifications and requirements for proper operation.
Thermal characteristics, detailed characteristics, test information, and package outline that cover the product's performance, testing procedures, and physical dimensions.
Soldering guidelines and instructions for properly integrating and assembling the product in various applications.

Electrical Characteristics.content: Table 8 provides electrical characteristics such as working voltage (VZ), differential resistance (rdiff), temperature coefficient (SZ), diode capacitance (Cd), and non-repetitive peak reverse current (IZSM) for BZB784-C2V4 to BZB784-C15 zener diodes at a junction temperature of 25°C. The typical and maximum values are specified for different test conditions like IZ = 5 mA, IZ = 1 mA, f = 1 MHz, and VR = 0 V.

The temperature coefficient (SZ) is a function of the working current, as shown in Fig. 3 for BZB784-C5V1 to C15 zener diodes. The typical values of the temperature coefficient are provided for different working current levels.

The product has been qualified according to the Automotive Electronics Council (AEC) standard Q101 for stress test qualification of discrete semiconductors, making it suitable for use in automotive applications.

Packaging Information.content: 13. Soldering - This section covers information related to soldering processes for the component package, including reflow soldering and wave soldering footprints.
Fig. 5. Reflow soldering footprint for SC-70 (SOT323) - This figure illustrates the recommended footprint for reflow soldering the SC-70 (SOT323) package.
Fig. 6. Wave soldering footprint for SC-70 (SOT323) - This figure shows the recommended footprint for wave soldering the SC-70 (SOT323) package.
